Hi there! I am a college student and my partner and I need to contribute to an open source project for a class on Virtualization. We'd love to work on something in Kubernetes and we have about a month (5-6h/week). Do any of these issues look like they would be good for us? We are open to any suggestions!
<https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/46172>
<https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/48926>
<https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/49673>
<https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/49586>

hey, can anyone do a status update on <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/56686> ? <@U0YJS6LHL> <@U4H2924GN>  I realize people are in transit to Kubecon, but if someone could take a look at that, it would be great
<https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/52973>
it's probably similar to <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/56516>
FYI <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/56416>
thoughts on <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/56794> ?

<@U4NELQ5QS> mentioned this might be a problem <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/52419> because relative symlinks aren't working on Windows, but I thought secrets were working in 1.7 without symlinks
<https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/47820> - this is listed as a release-blocker issue for v1.8, is anyone from sig-apps actively working on this?

Hi all we are observing a strange behvaiour where rbac/v1 apis are getting available only after ~5-6 mins on api-server start up, had raised an issue <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/56899> is anyone else also seeing this? It happens only when we migrate 1.7.7 to 1.8.4. After moving to 1.8.4 even if we restart API server, rbac/v1 apis are immediately available

Hello, I want to follow up on <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/23008>. It appears this issue was resolved. 
I am running into similar issue with high `kubelet` CPU usage, and as it seems due to `cAdviser`. I am on `kubelet` `v1.7.6`
Hello, it seems i am running into `Kubelet` + `cAdvisor` + High CPU issue similar to the one reported in: <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/23008>
Running version 1.9.0-alpha.2 of kubelet on a fresh Windows 1709 build, and think I'm running into this: <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/55031> . Has anyone else experienced this?

And if it is, how made it, how are you dealing with the Client-ID and Client-secret in the kubectl, do you that is a security issue? I read carefully this discussion: `<https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/37822>`, but I still don't get it
looks like someone reported a similar bug driven by the same behavior but for different causes <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/37414>
attached issue <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/57280>
<@U0BGPQ6DS> here you are: <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/57769>
<https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/50761>

happy holiday :slightly_smiling_face:

That can be closed because test-infra one(<https://github.com/kubernetes/test-infra/issues/5701>) is merged instead
Hi, I was wondering if I could get some feedback on <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/56304> thanks
hi, is there a way to get memory request for a container from prometheus metrics? something similar to this: <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/40214>

<@U8B9K1ZPG> <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/37822> is a good summary of the state of things. it depends on your provider, which may have some concept of "public clients" where the client-secret isn't secret
<https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/44418>
Hi all, if someone could comment on my problems in this defect: <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/56304> that would be really helpful, thanks

It also has discussion around CRI in the related issue: <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/49398>

<@U69QYR4TV>.. did you have any luck with the etcd open connections issue? <@U6S1GQY1H> and I are colleagues.
 <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/54138/> is the issue we are following, but it appears to be ignored, so we might be alone. Custom deployment on your end?

ApiServers seem to be maintaining the connections to etcd, reconnecting them if etcd goes down. I guess it's a leak of goroutines.

hi all, 
is this issue  <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/20112>  has been solved or just closed ? I cannot find away to get the endpoint from service object

hi guys, I'm struggling to schedule a kube-router daemon set on a newly created set of 1.8.2 k8s nodes in a NotReady state. It seems to be very similar effect to <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/23013>, but recreating the daemonset doesn't help: it still says 0 Desired nodes . Is this something that's changed in 1.8.2 (I was able to do this in 1.7.5 just fine)?
<https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/44160> is the closest thing we have to that design document right now, as far as I know.

How is federation / multicluster upgrades currently handled?  Is there a guarantee of N-1 support, or do all clusters need to be upgraded concurrently?  Saw this, but it seems to have gone offtopic? <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/44160>  Thanks
<@U0B93RF4N> <@U4723UJL8> <@U6DN3CFF1> can we have an update on the horizontal pod autoscaler test failure?  <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/54574>

Federated service discovery failed in hybrid cloud: OpenStack + GKE:
<https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/55326>

kubefed can't set up federation correctly, because it does stupid things:
```
r}   Warning   InspectFailed   kubelet, gke-kubernetes-cluster-pool-1-76a09ebd-b587   Failed to apply default image tag "<http://gcr.io/google_containers/hyperkube-amd64:v1.8.0+0b9efaeb34a2f|gcr.io/google_containers/hyperkube-amd64:v1.8.0+0b9efaeb34a2f>": couldn't parse image reference "<http://gcr.io/google_containers/hyperkube-amd64:v1.8.0+0b9efaeb34a2f|gcr.io/google_containers/hyperkube-amd64:v1.8.0+0b9efaeb34a2f>": invalid reference format
2017-10-04 14:07:14 +0200 CEST   2017-10-04 14:00:47 +0200 CEST   31        fed-zone-europe-controller-manager-4130961042-m9c3z.14ea5c3e2a63466e   Pod                 Warning   FailedSync   kubelet, gke-kubernetes-cluster-pool-1-76a09ebd-b587   Error syncing pod
```

How do people work around that? Information is here: <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/53430>
